definitions: able to be turned the other way around
shortDefinitions: able to be turned other way round

definitions: (of a garment, fabric, or bedclothes) faced on both sides so as to be worn or used with either outside
shortDefinitions: faced on both sides so as to be worn or used with either outside

definitions: (of the effects of a process or condition) capable of being reversed so that the previous state or situation is restored

examples.text: potentially reversible forms of renal failure

shortDefinitions: capable of being reversed so that previous state is restored

definitions: (of a reaction) occurring together with its converse, and so yielding an equilibrium mixture of reactants and products

examples.text: the formation of ethyl acetate from ethyl alcohol and acetic acid is a reversible reaction

shortDefinitions: (of reaction) occurring together with its converse, and so yielding equilibrium mixture of reactants and products

definitions: (of a change or process) capable of complete and detailed reversal, especially denoting or undergoing an ideal change in which a system is in thermodynamic equilibrium at all times

examples.text: the entropy change is zero only in the limiting case of a reversible process

shortDefinitions: (of change or process) capable of complete and detailed reversal

definitions: (of a colloid) capable of being changed from a gel into a sol by a reversal of the treatment which turns the sol into a gel
shortDefinitions: (of colloid) capable of being changed from gel into sol by reversal of treatment
